reviews.text: We only stayed at the Elite one night, but found it to be more than adequate for our needs. The room was spacious and clean. The bathroom was huge. The staff is incredibly nice and helpful. No breakfast, which was fine for us because we left early to go back to the airport. This hotel is very convenient to the train and bus station, but be forewarned that it's a slightly dodgy area (pickpockets, etc.) because there are so many hotels & tourists. The only drawback I found was the fact that it's on the second floor...and there is no lift. Don't stay here if you have tons of luggage!
reviews.title: Friendly, clean, basic

reviews.text: First, let me just say I would sleep on the ponte veccio just to be in Florence at any given moment since my husband and I returned from there. But...instead we did stay at the Hotel Elite. What a wonderful experience, we felt as if we were in a movie, small, quaint room, little shower in the bathroom, nice and comfortablel bed and shutters that swing open to reveal the sights and sounds of Florence below. If you are looking to really enjoy Italy and have a clean, safe place to lay your head then stay here...if you are looking for fancy down comforters and room service...well then you don't deserve to be in Italy in the first place!
reviews.title: La Dolce Vita
Really enjoyed my stay!
reviews.text: I have just recently returned from a week long stay in Florence, May 17 - May 22/06 staying 4 nights at the Hotel Elite, which I found in the Let's Go Italy Guide Book. First of all you need to appreciate hotels in Florence are very expensive and seem to be always booked so you really get what you pay for. Hotel Elite is really close to the train station in a relative safe area. To get up to the hotel you enter through a gate and head up the dark stairs which can seem daunting at first, but it's a cute little hotel that's typical. for Florence. The good thing is you can walk from here to all the major sites in the about 10 minutes or less.

I paid 70 euros a night for a double room for myself with shower and toilet included. Always confirm you want a private shower and toilet the room! It was a nice clean room with a comfy bed, tv, air, clean modern bathroom - except for the fact my bathroom was one of those shower rooms where there isn't really a tub or shower stall - so half the bathroom gets wet (as it's supposed to when you shower...(it took a bit of getting used to I must admit) but I noticed that other rooms had regular showers I knoticed.
reviews.title: Huge rooms, clean, close to train station!!!
Personal attention makes the Elite special
reviews.text: The real appeal of this hotel is the wonderful, friendly, knowlegeable manager Nadia Who is a real gem. She helps her guest reserve gallery tickets, knows what's worth seeing and is just helpful and wonderful. She made my stay worthwile. Hotel Elite has a 2 star rating which I think is appropriate after staying at a 1 star in Florence a few days later.

reviews.title: Staff made us feel like part of the family!
reviews.text: I recommend this hotel for the money...but book early! Also May was the absolute perfect month to visit Florence for prices, beautiful temperatures, and the fact that the city isn't overcrowded!
